Reputation has "value" because it is relatively limited. When we increase the supply of reputation available to give away, it cheapens the value of that reputation.

Personally, I'm in favor of **lowering** the reputation limit to 5 times per day and having the value equal to 5 times what it is now. That way, the total number of reputation available to give away remains the same (25 reputation per 24 hours), but increases the value of that reputation. I'd also like to reinstate the "You must spread some reputation around before giving it to [person you just gave rep to]" policy again.

But those are unpopular changes, and I'm not willing to upset the forum over them.

I only once ran out of likes and it was quite annoying. I generally only like something if it was impressive or made me laugh. There are some times though when you wish to acknowledge that you have read something without writing a message. If suggestions are a thing that are both acknowledged and can actually be implemented, I would like to suggest that if you have been tagged in a post then an "Acknowledge Button" turns up next to the "Like Button" so that you may convey that you have seen it.
